abstract.p: Andy Borowitz Op-Ed article speculates on future television-altering electronic devices that may complicate network executives' lives even further (S)

block.p: As the fall TV season gets under way, network honchos find themselves trapped in their own version of ''Survivor,'' with a nemesis more treacherous than a rat, a snake or a fat naked guy: a new electronic device called TiVo, which eliminates TV commercials. But TiVo may just be the beginning. If it proves successful, it is only a matter of time before manufacturers produce other TV-altering devices to complicate network executives' lives even further:
TeenGo: Filters out vapid dialogue from teenage drama shows; voice-recognition feature activated by the words ''popular,'' ''unfair'' and ''duh.''

As the fall TV season gets under way, network honchos find themselves trapped in their own version of ''Survivor,'' with a nemesis more treacherous than a rat, a snake or a fat naked guy: a new electronic device called TiVo, which eliminates TV commercials. But TiVo may just be the beginning. If it proves successful, it is only a matter of time before manufacturers produce other TV-altering devices to complicate network executives' lives even further:
TeenGo: Filters out vapid dialogue from teenage drama shows; voice-recognition feature activated by the words ''popular,'' ''unfair'' and ''duh.''
VeTo: Instantly zaps a program that is regrettably the favorite of one's spouse; popular settings include ''WWF Smackdown'' and ''Antiques Roadshow.''
SleaZo: Eliminates blatant network rip-offs of HBO's ''Sex and the City.''
KathieLeeVo: In a nod to the ratings surge enjoyed by ''Live with Regis'' since the departure of Regis Philbin's co-host, removes Kathie Lee Gifford from all other shows in which she might appear.
SqueaKo: Excises all subliminal references to rodents from negative campaign ads.
GeeZo: Prevents the broadcast of heavyweight boxing matches between former champions over the age of 60.
DeleTo: Instantly edits out all F.T.C. officials' Hollywood-blaming speeches that feature the phrase, ''This isn't about censorship.''

HeaveHo: Seeks out and eliminates all programs destined for an early cancellation; device is set to be especially sensitive to programs featuring single dads coping with unruly broods of smart-mouthed children, and any talk shows involving Roseanne.
Andy Borowitz is the author of ''The Trillionaire Next Door.''
